field.name: summary
field.value: RelationType.List and .Map doesn't work without an Index specification

field.name: description
field.value:
If you specify a HasMany-relationship using RelationType = RelationType.List and omitting the Index-parameter (that specifies the column that handles the ordering), NHibernate will crash with the following error:
[IndexOutOfRangeException: Index was outside the bounds of the array.] NHibernate.Mapping.Column.set_Name(String value) in c:\CSharp\NH\nhibernate\src\NHibernate\Mapping\Column.cs:85
Because the column-name for Index defaults to an empty string. Either create a default column-name, or throw an exception on initialization that Index is missing from the Attribute.

comment.author: mzywitza
comment.text: Added a check to fail on initialization.
